overview: 2 Samuel covers David's reign as king of Israel—his triumphs, his devastating sin with Bathsheba, and its consequences. It contains God's covenant promise that David's throne would endure forever.

verses.text: And your house and your kingdom shall be made sure forever before me. Your throne shall be established forever.
The LORD is my rock and my fortress and my deliverer, my God, my rock, in whom I take refuge, my shield, and the horn of my salvation, my stronghold and my refuge, my savior.
David said to Nathan, 'I have sinned against the LORD.' And Nathan said to David, 'The LORD also has put away your sin; you shall not die.'

passages.title: The Davidic Covenant
passages.summary: God promises David an eternal dynasty—fulfilled ultimately in Jesus, the Son of David who reigns forever.

passages.title: David and Bathsheba
passages.summary: David's adultery and murder, Nathan's confrontation, and David's repentance. Even forgiven sin brings lasting consequences.

passages.title: Absalom's Rebellion
passages.summary: David's son attempts to seize the throne, forcing David to flee. Despite everything, David grieves deeply when Absalom dies.

facts.text: The Davidic covenant (2 Samuel 7) is foundational to understanding Jesus as the promised Messiah, the eternal King from David's line.
David's sin with Bathsheba led to the death of four of his sons, fulfilling Nathan's prophecy that 'the sword shall never depart from your house.'
Jerusalem became Israel's capital when David captured it from the Jebusites—it's called the 'City of David' to this day.
Psalm 51, David's famous confession of sin, was written after Nathan confronted him about Bathsheba.

figures.name: David
figures.description: Israel's greatest king, a man after God's own heart despite serious failures. God made an everlasting covenant with him fulfilled in Christ.

figures.name: Bathsheba
figures.description: Wife of Uriah, taken by David in his great sin. She later became Solomon's mother and an ancestor of Jesus.

figures.name: Nathan
figures.description: A prophet who courageously confronted David about his sin and later supported Solomon's succession to the throne.

figures.name: Absalom
figures.description: David's handsome, ambitious son who led a rebellion against his father, representing the consequences of David's earlier sins.

videos.title: 2 Samuel Overview
videos.description: The Bible Project explores David's reign, his covenant, and the consequences of his choices.
